name: Carolyn's Poor Man's Lobster
ingredients: 4 ounce fresh or frozen haddock fillet
Water, enough to cover the fish
2 teaspoons granular Splenda or equivalent liquid Splenda
Garlic or garlic powder, to taste

instructions.en: Place the haddock fillet in a deep-sided skillet. Add just enough water to cover the fish.
Add vinegar, salt, and Splenda to the water.
Bring to a boil and cook for 5-8 minutes or until the fish turns white and feels firm but isn't flaking.
Remove the fish from the water with a slotted spoon and place on a broiler pan.
Broil for 2 minutes per side to dry out the fish.
Combine the melted butter and garlic powder.
Serve the fish dipped in the garlic butter.

notes: A 4 ounce fillet will yield between 2 1/2 and 2 3/4 ounces of cooked fish. This recipe can be frozen. The amounts of vinegar, salt, and Splenda are per fillet, so adjust accordingly if cooking multiple fillets.
